description.narrative: The incidence rate The treatment success rate The notification rate # of TB-MDR detected cases The mortality rate

comment.narrative: The incidence rate of 17 per100000 population - 2013 The treatment success rate of 84% - 2011 The notification rate of 12 per 100000 population - 2013 7 TB-MDR detected cases quarterly - 2013 The mortality rate 2.1 per 100000 - 2013

Reach the incidence rate of 17per 100000 population Reach the treatment success rate of 90% Reach the notification rate 12 per 100000 Maintain the case detection of the TB-MDR patients to 7 per quarter Reach the mortality rate of 1.4 per 100000

As per Global Tuberculosis Report 2015 by WHO: The incidence rate is 17per 100000 population The treatment success rate is 80% The notification rate is 19 per 100000 The case detection rate of the TB-MDR patients to 31 in 2014 The mortality rate is <0.1 per 100000

capital of a political entity
capital of a political entity
1. Number of patients who received their medication through the new system installed

comment.narrative:
No available system with updated data for doctors to review cancer cases remotly and all documents pertaining to cases remain in paper format.
Cancer patients are obliged to travel across the country in order to retrieve treatment records and history in order to proceed with further therapy

description.narrative: Coordination systems for early recovery and livelihoods enhanced
capital of a political entity
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - disaster prevention and preparedness

Biannual reports on the Impact of the Crisis # of area-based livelihoods and socioeconomic assessments conducted # of governorate profiles conducted # of comprehensive area based initiatives informed by area based response plans. # of updated 4W produced maps activities of all partners # of ER&L meetings convened # of meetings under the WOS coordination # of planning reports and assessments under the WOS coordination (SRP, HNOs, etc) # of collaborative baseline surveys and system parameters conducted by the IM team.

comment.narrative: No “early recovery” cluster activated; livelihoods working group in place, chaired by UNDP, Sector working groups in place; No governmental coordination mechanism on livelihoods in place Lack of up to date livelihood and damage assessments

Biannual reports on the Impact of the Crisis issued At least 6 area-based livelihoods and socioeconomic assessments to be conducted At least 6 governorate profiles to be conducted At least 50 comprehensive area based initiatives informed by area based response plans. 1 meetings per month of ER&L working group convened Updated 4W produced mapping activities of all partners 1 meeting per month under the WOS coordination Yearly planning reports and assessments under the WOS coordination (SRP, HNOs, etc) Baseline surveys on sectoral thematic areas conducted to set the system parameters.

1 Biannual report on the Impact of the Crisis 2015 developed 8 governorates profiles completed alone with severity ranking exercise for 14 governorates 112 comprehensive area based initiatives informed by area based response plans 1 monthly meeting conducted for ER&L working group 12 4Ws produced mapping activities of all partners 4 meetings under the WOS coordination conducted 3 Yearly planning reports and assessments under the WOS coordination (HRP, HNOs, WOSA) 1 HNO survey on sectoral thematic areas conducted

description.narrative: livelihoods and community resilience initiatives.
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - disaster prevention and preparedness

# of CBOs and NGOs receiving specialized capacity development and training # of NGOs receiving grants to implement local level initiatives # of youth involved in nature of inter and intra-communal activities focusing on social cohesion and community resilience through different entry points

comment.narrative: Loss of livelihood capitals (human, financial, social, physical, natural) Limited CBOs’ capacity to respond to the current unrest in the country and respond to the needs of the affected population Limited local level social cohesion and community resilience activities

Capacity assessment conducted for the capacities of 50 NGOs conducted Three manuals to be prepared on ER&L, NGO management and project cycle management At least 70 NGOs and CBOs trained on livelihoods and early recovery concepts including social cohesion and community resilience. At least 6 NGOs receiving grants to implement local level social cohesion and community resilience initiatives. Piloting the implementation of twinning programme between NGOs/CBOs. 4 peer-to-peer network, Workshops, and Meetings in three governorates conducted Drama therapy, Sport for Peace, Music and Art for Peace, Food for Peace initiatives implemented in the four target governorates

Capacity assessment of 50 NGOs/CBOs conducted Three manuals on ER&L, NGO management and project cycle management prepared. 140 70 NGOs and CBOs trained on livelihoods and early recovery concepts including social cohesion and community resilience. 15 NGOs/CBOs received grants to implement local level social cohesion and community resilience initiatives. 4 peer-to-peer network, Workshops, and Meetings in three governorates conducted. Drama therapy, Sport for Peace, Music and Art for Peace, Food for Peace initiatives implemented in the five target governorates
